required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Adding Nalbuphine to Intrathecal Morphine on Analgesic Efficacy and Side Effects After Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Post-cesarean Section Analgesic Potency and Side Effects of Intrathecal Morphine and Nalbuphine

brief_summary.textblock: The primary endpoint of this study is to investigate the effect of adding nalbuphine to intrathecal morphine on quality of postoperative analgesia and Morphine related side effects post- cesarean delivery.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be performed in Assiut University Hospitals, after obtaining approval from the local ethics committee and written informed patient consent. All patients will have a peripheral IV cannula 18 G inserted; standard non-invasive monitors will be applied. All the patients will be preloaded with 10 ml/kg Ringer's lactate solution intravenous. Intrathecal block under strict aseptic conditions will be performed in sitting position at L3-4 or L4-5 inter-spinous space with 25G pencil-point spinal needle. All patients will receive intrathecal 10 mg of 0.5% hyperbaric bupivacaine.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with incidence of postoperative nausea
number of participants with incidence of postoperative vomiting
number of participants with incidence of postoperative postdural puncture headache
number of participants with incidence of postoperative respiratory depression

intervention.description: 38 patients of this group will receive 10 mg of 0.5% hyperbaric bupivacaine (Buvanest Spinal 0.5% Heavy) with 0.2 mg morphine (Infumorph - Injection 10 mg/mL) in 0.5 ml volume (total volume 2.5 mL). Patients will be preloaded with 10 ml/kg Ringer's lactate solution intravenous.

39 patients of this group will receive 10 mg of 0.5% hyperbaric bupivacaine (Buvanest Spinal 0.5% Heavy) with 0.5 mg morphine (Infumorph - Injection 10 mg/mL) plus 0.2 mg nalbuphine (NALUFIN 20MG/ML AMP) in 0.5 ml volume (total volume 2.5 mL). Patients will be preloaded with 10 ml/kg Ringer's lactate solution intravenous.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients
- age between 16 to 40 years
- ASA physical status I - II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infection at the site of injection.
- Coagulopathy or other bleeding diathesis.
- Preexisting neurologic deficits.
- History of hypersensitivity to any of the given the drugs.
- Inability to communicate with the investigator and the hospital staff.
- History of chronic opioid us

overall_official.affiliation: Assistant professor of anesthesia and intensive care

reference.citation: Culebras X, Gaggero G, Zatloukal J, Kern C, Marti RA. Advantages of intrathecal nalbuphine, compared with intrathecal morphine, after cesarean delivery: an evaluation of postoperative analgesia and adverse effects. Anesth Analg. 2000 Sep;91(3):601-5.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant professor of Anesthesia and ICU
